DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Studying gene express sample tumor tissue patient cancer may help doctor identify biomarkers related cancer . PURPOSE : This research study look tumor tissue sample patient stage I , stage II , stage III malignant melanoma .
DOC.brief_title: Study Tumor Tissue Samples From Patients With Stage I , Stage II , Stage III Malignant Melanoma
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine genetic profile primary melanoma without synchronous regional nodal involvement examine 1 ) activate mutation B-Raf N-Ras associate melanoma development , 2 ) allelic imbalance across genome . - Compare genetic profile primary melanoma patient without lymph node involvement . - Determine combination genetic lesion correlate nodal metastasis adopt statistical machine learn approach build lesion-based classifier nodal metastasis . OUTLINE : Laser capture microdissection perform archived tissue sample isolate melanoma cell . DNA purify sample amplify use PCR . Matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization ( MALDI ) -time flight mass spectrometry technology use detect mutation B-Raf N-Ras . Single nucleotide polymorphism array also perform . Information patient 's demographic ( e.g. , TNM staging , sex , age , tissue collection date ) gather chart review Multidisciplinary Melanoma Conference University Hospitals tumor conference report order match case .
DOC.criteria: Node positive Group ( experimental group ) Primary melanoma > 2 mm depth Metastasis must > 0.1 mm detectable IHC hematoxylin eosin ( H & E ) consider node positive Slides block primary node must archive UH dermatopathology Node Negative Group ( control group ) Primary melanoma > 2 mm depth A negative sentinel lymph node must negative IHC H & E No stage IV disease No acral mucosal histology No history prior invasive melanoma Underwent primary excision sentinel lymph node biopsy within 3 month Archived tissue available Slides block primary tumor node biopsy must archive University Hospitals Case Medical Center ( UH ) dermatopathology Acral mucosal histology Previous diagnosis invasive melanoma previous chemotherapy immunotherapy patient find stage IV disease workup
